title: Stock market today: Nasdaq edges back from its record as chip companies and Eli Lilly slump
summary: U.S. stock indexes edged lower after drops for Eli Lilly and chip companies overshadowed a jump for Google’s parent company. The S&P 500 slipped 0.3% Wednesday.

title: US economy grew at a solid 2.8% pace last quarter on strength of consumer spending
IMF chief warns that world risks falling into slow-growth rut and urges China to enact reforms
Yellen says isolationism ‘made America and the world worse off’ in speech to global finance leaders
China’s economy grows at a 4.6% rate in the last quarter, falls short of the official 5% target
China’s exports slow sharply in September, adding to worries over the economy
summary: China’s exports slowed sharply in September as global demand weakened, adding to worries over how to recharge growth in the world’s second-largest economy.

title: South Korea’s central bank cuts rates in a bid to boost the economy
summary: South Korea’s central bank cut its policy rate for the first time in more than four years as pressure to revive a sluggish economy outweighed concerns about the country’s level of household debt.

title: Germany’s economy is on track to shrink for a second straight year
summary: Germany’s government says its economy is on track to shrink for a second consecutive year. The German economy is Europe’s biggest.

title: China announces more support for economy but holds back on major spending package
summary: China’s economic planning agency has outlined details of measures aimed at boosting the economy but refrained from major spending initiatives.

title: US adds a robust 254,000 jobs and unemployment dips to 4.1% in sign of still-sturdy labor market
summary: America’s employers added a surprisingly strong 254,000 jobs in September, easing concerns about a weakening labor market and suggesting that the pace of hiring is still solid enough to support a growing economy.

title: Stock market today: Dow rallies to a record after a blockbuster jobs report
summary: U.S. stocks rallied after a surprisingly strong U.S. jobs report raised optimism about the economy. The S&P 500 climbed 0.9% Friday to near its all-time high set on Monday.

title: US economy grew at a solid 3% rate last quarter, government says in final estimate
summary: The American economy expanded at a healthy 3% annual pace from April through June, boosted by strong consumer spending and business investment, the government said, leaving its previous estimate unchanged.

title: China redoubles first-aid for its economy with support for banks and workers
summary: China is redoubling its first-aid for the economy, targeting banks, workers and poor families as the ruling Communist Party prepares to mark the 75th anniversary of the founding of the People’s Republic.

title: Harris is making a ‘capitalist’ pitch to boost the economy as Trump pushes deeper into populism
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris is pledging to build an economy that is both pro-business and helps the middle class as she pushes back against Republican nominee Donald Trump’s claims that she’s advancing “communist” ideas.

title: Asian Development Bank raises growth forecast for region, but warns of risks from trade sanctions
summary: The Asian Development Bank says it expects developing economies in the region to grow at a 5% annual pace this year, up slightly from its earlier estimate of 4.9% growth.

title: Japan’s economy is growing, but political uncertainty is among the risks
summary: Japan’s economy grew at an annual rate of 2.9%, slower than the earlier report for 3.1% growth, in the April-June period, boosted by better wages and spending.

title: Stock market today: Wall Street falls sharply to close its worst week in nearly 18 months
summary: Another rout hit Wall Street after an update on the U.S. job market came in weak enough to add to worries about the economy.

title: Stock market today: Wall Street tumbles on worries about the economy, and Dow drops more than 600
summary: U.S. stocks tumbled to their worst day since an early August sell-off after another report raised worries about the economy’s health.

title: US economic growth for last quarter is revised up to a solid 3% annual rate
summary: The U.S. economy grew last quarter at a healthy 3% annual pace, fueled by strong consumer spending and business investment, the government said in an upgrade of its initial assessment.

title: US shoppers sharply boosted spending at retailers in July despite higher prices
summary: Americans stepped up spending at retailers last month by the most in a year and a half, easing concerns that the economy might be weakening under the pressure of higher prices and elevated interest rates.

title: UK economy grows 0.6% between April and June as it recovers from recession
summary: Official figures show that Britain’s economy continued its recovery from recession at the end of last year, with its GDP increasing by 0.6% between April and June.

title: Japan’s economy grew last quarter on healthy consumer spending and business investment
summary: Japan’s economy grew at an annual rate of 3.1% last quarter, rebounding from the contraction in the previous quarter.

title: Wall Street ends a wild and scary week almost exactly where it began. More tests loom next week
summary: U.S. stocks closed a wild, whipsaw week for Wall Street with modest gains. The S&P 500 rose 0.5% Friday, coming off its best day since 2022, trimming its loss for the week down to less than 0.1%.

title: Saudi Arabia’s Aramco reports lower half-year profits as economic worries dampen energy prices
summary: Saudi oil giant Aramco has reported half-year profits of $56.3 billion, down from the year before due to weakening volumes sold amid worries about the global economy.

title: Nearly everything on Wall Street tumbles over worries the U.S. is headed for an economic slowdown
summary: The drops were just the latest in a sell-off that swept global markets, with Japan’s Nikkei 225 having its worst day since the Black Monday crash of 1987.

title: The Fed’s high rates spur fear of slowdown, yet recession signals have so far proved wrong
summary: The turmoil shaking global financial markets reflects a sudden fear that the Federal Reserve may have held its key interest rate too high for too long, heightening the risk of a U.S. recession.

title: Stock market today: Dow drops 600 on weak jobs data as a global sell-off whips back to Wall Street
summary: Stocks tumbled Friday on worries the U.S. economy could be cracking under the weight of high interest rates meant to whip inflation. The S&P 500 fell 1.8% Friday.

title: US hiring fell sharply in July, an unexpected setback for the economy stoking recession fears
summary: The U.S. economy suffered an unexpected setback in July, as hiring fell sharply and the unemployment rate rose for the fourth straight month in a sign that higher interest rates may be taking a bigger toll on businesses and consumers.

title: Bank of Japan raises its key interest rate, aiming to curb yen’s slide against the dollar
summary: The Bank of Japan has raised its key interest rate to 0.25% from a range of zero to about 0.1%, acting to curb the yen’s slide against the U.S. dollar.

title: Ethiopia’s currency dives by 30% as IMF-backed reforms to stabilize the economy take effect
summary: Ethiopia’s currency has lost 30% of its value the day after the central bank began implementing a flexible exchange rate policy backed by the International Monetary Fund as part of new measures to stabilize the eastern African nation’s economy.

title: China’s top leaders vow to support consumers and improve confidence in its slowing economy
summary: China’s powerful Politburo has endorsed the ruling Communist Party’s strategy for growing the economy by encouraging more consumer spending and weeding out unproductive companies to promote “survival of the fittest.”

title: Europe’s growth lags US again, as Germany remains the eurozone’s economic problem child
summary: Europe’s economy enjoyed only modest growth in the April-June quarter even as the U.S. outperformed expectations, highlighting a persistent transatlantic growth gap.

title: US economic growth increased last quarter to a healthy 2.8% annual rate
summary: The nation’s economy accelerated last quarter at a strong 2.8% annual pace, with consumers and businesses helping drive growth despite the pressure of continually high interest rates.

title: China moves to pep up its slowing economy, lays out roadmap for its future
summary: China’s central bank has cut key interest rates in a surprise move aimed at injecting pep into the economy, while the ruling Communist Party released a 50-page roadmap addressing long-term challenges.

title: China’s Communist Party charts technology- and security-focused development for reviving the economy
summary: In a year of major elections setting the course of many countries for years to come, China’s ruling Communist Party is holding top-level meetings in Beijing to draft policies for reviving its slowing economy.
